greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Coefficients of the '10th-order' mock theta function chi(q).
reference: Youn-Seo Choi, Tenth order mock theta functions in Ramanujan's lost notebook, Inventiones Mathematicae, 136 (1999) 497-569
Srinivasa Ramanujan, The Lost Notebook and Other Unpublished Papers, Narosa Publishing House, New Delhi, 1988, p. 9
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (corrected and extended previous b-file from G. C. Greubel)
formula: a(n) ~ -(-1)^n * sqrt(phi) * exp(Pi*sqrt(n/10)) / (2*5^(1/4)*sqrt(n)), where phi = A001622 = (1+sqrt(5))/2 is the golden ratio. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 12 2019
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Sum[(-1)^k * x^((k+1)^2)/Product[1+x^j, {j, 1, 2*k+1}], {k, 0, Floor[Sqrt[nmax]]}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 11 2019 *)
xref: Other '10th-order' mock theta functions are at A053281, A053282, A053283.
results.author: _Dean Hickerson_, Dec 19 1999
